item.title: Towards a critical data practice
item.description: Episode 1 Whether we are aware of this phenomenon or not, we are all data collectors. Our brains are carefully (and sometimes seemingly randomly) collecting and storing informations, ranging from personal experiences to learnt facts and knowledge. I believe prioritising asking the right questions and listening actively, promotes a culture of learning, furthermore allowing us to have a direct influence on our assembled data. I dedicate my first article to the first part of the data visualisation process - know the questions you want to answer.
